examples.title: Default
examples.description: AppProvider works by default without any additional options passed to it.

examples.title: With i18n
examples.description: With an `i18n`, `AppProvider` will provide these translations to polaris components. See [using translations](https://polaris.shopify.com/components/app-provider#using-translations)

examples.title: With linkComponent
examples.description: With a `linkComponent`, the app provider component will override the links used in other components. For example you may want to use the `Link` component provided by `react-router` throughout your application instead of the default `a` tag.

examples.title: Default
With i18n
With linkComponent

pageProps.seoDescription: App provider is a required component that enables sharing global settings throughout the hierarchy of your application.

AppProviderProps.name: AppProviderProps

members.name: i18n
members.description: A locale object or array of locale objects that overrides default translations. If specifying an array then your primary language dictionary should come first, followed by your fallback language dictionaries

members.name: linkComponent
members.description: A custom component to use for all links used by Polaris components

members.name: features
members.description: For toggling features

members.name: children
members.description: Inner content of the application

LinkLikeComponentProps.name: LinkLikeComponentProps

members.name: url
members.description: The url to link to

members.name: children
members.description: The content to display inside the link

members.name: external
members.description: Makes the link open in a new tab

members.name: target
members.description: Where to display the url

members.name: download
members.description: Makes the browser download the url instead of opening it. Provides a hint for the downloaded filename if it is a string value.

members.name: inputMode
members.description: Hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents

members.name: is
members.description: Specify that a standard HTML element should behave like a defined custom built-in element

members.name: aria-activedescendant
members.description: Identifies the currently active element when DOM focus is on a composite widget, textbox, group, or application.

members.name: aria-atomic
members.description: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region based on the change notifications defined by the aria-relevant attribute.

members.name: aria-autocomplete
members.description:
Indicates whether inputting text could trigger display of one or more predictions of the user's intended value for an input and specifies how predictions would be
presented if they are made.

members.name: aria-braillelabel
members.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element, which is intended to be converted into Braille.

members.name: aria-brailleroledescription
members.description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized abbreviated description for the role of an element, which is intended to be converted into Braille.

members.name: aria-checked
members.description: Indicates the current "checked" state of checkboxes, radio buttons, and other widgets.

members.name: aria-colcount
members.description: Defines the total number of columns in a table, grid, or treegrid.

members.name: aria-colindex
members.description: Defines an element's column index or position with respect to the total number of columns within a table, grid, or treegrid.

members.name: aria-colindextext
members.description: Defines a human readable text alternative of aria-colindex.

members.name: aria-colspan
members.description: Defines the number of columns spanned by a cell or gridcell within a table, grid, or treegrid.

members.name: aria-controls
members.description: Identifies the element (or elements) whose contents or presence are controlled by the current element.

members.name: aria-current
members.description: Indicates the element that represents the current item within a container or set of related elements.

members.name: aria-describedby
members.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object.

members.name: aria-description
members.description: Defines a string value that describes or annotates the current element.

members.name: aria-details
members.description: Identifies the element that provides a detailed, extended description for the object.

members.name: aria-disabled
members.description: Indicates that the element is perceivable but disabled, so it is not editable or otherwise operable.

members.name: aria-dropeffect
members.description: Indicates what functions can be performed when a dragged object is released on the drop target.

members.name: aria-errormessage
members.description: Identifies the element that provides an error message for the object.

members.name: aria-expanded
members.description: Indicates whether the element, or another grouping element it controls, is currently expanded or collapsed.

members.name: aria-flowto
members.description:
Identifies the next element (or elements) in an alternate reading order of content which, at the user's discretion,
allows assistive technology to override the general default of reading in document source order.

members.name: aria-grabbed
members.description: Indicates an element's "grabbed" state in a drag-and-drop operation.

members.name: aria-haspopup
members.description: Indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element, such as menu or dialog, that can be triggered by an element.

members.name: aria-hidden
members.description: Indicates whether the element is exposed to an accessibility API.

members.name: aria-invalid
members.description: Indicates the entered value does not conform to the format expected by the application.

members.name: aria-keyshortcuts
members.description: Indicates keyboard shortcuts that an author has implemented to activate or give focus to an element.

members.name: aria-label
members.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element.

members.name: aria-labelledby
members.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element.

members.name: aria-level
members.description: Defines the hierarchical level of an element within a structure.

members.name: aria-live
members.description: Indicates that an element will be updated, and describes the types of updates the user agents, assistive technologies, and user can expect from the live region.

members.name: aria-modal
members.description: Indicates whether an element is modal when displayed.

members.name: aria-multiline
members.description: Indicates whether a text box accepts multiple lines of input or only a single line.

members.name: aria-multiselectable
members.description: Indicates that the user may select more than one item from the current selectable descendants.

members.name: aria-orientation
members.description: Indicates whether the element's orientation is horizontal, vertical, or unknown/ambiguous.

members.name: aria-owns
members.description:
Identifies an element (or elements) in order to define a visual, functional, or contextual parent/child relationship
between DOM elements where the DOM hierarchy cannot be used to represent the relationship.

members.name: aria-placeholder
members.description:
Defines a short hint (a word or short phrase) intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value.
A hint could be a sample value or a brief description of the expected format.

members.name: aria-posinset
members.description: Defines an element's number or position in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the DOM.

members.name: aria-pressed
members.description: Indicates the current "pressed" state of toggle buttons.

members.name: aria-readonly
members.description: Indicates that the element is not editable, but is otherwise operable.

members.name: aria-relevant
members.value: "text" | "additions" | "additions removals" | "additions text" | "all" | "removals" | "removals additions" | "removals text" | "text additions" | "text removals"
members.description: Indicates what notifications the user agent will trigger when the accessibility tree within a live region is modified.

members.name: aria-required
members.description: Indicates that user input is required on the element before a form may be submitted.

members.name: aria-roledescription
members.description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized description for the role of an element.

members.name: aria-rowcount
members.description: Defines the total number of rows in a table, grid, or treegrid.

members.name: aria-rowindex
members.description: Defines an element's row index or position with respect to the total number of rows within a table, grid, or treegrid.

members.name: aria-rowindextext
members.description: Defines a human readable text alternative of aria-rowindex.

members.name: aria-rowspan
members.description: Defines the number of rows spanned by a cell or gridcell within a table, grid, or treegrid.

members.name: aria-selected
members.description: Indicates the current "selected" state of various widgets.

members.name: aria-setsize
members.description: Defines the number of items in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the DOM.

members.name: aria-sort
members.description: Indicates if items in a table or grid are sorted in ascending or descending order.

members.name: aria-valuemax
members.description: Defines the maximum allowed value for a range widget.

members.name: aria-valuemin
members.description: Defines the minimum allowed value for a range widget.

members.name: aria-valuenow
members.description: Defines the current value for a range widget.

members.name: aria-valuetext
members.description: Defines the human readable text alternative of aria-valuenow for a range widget.

members.name: ref
members.description:
Allows getting a ref to the component instance.
Once the component unmounts, React will set `ref.current` to `null` (or call the ref with `null` if you passed a callback ref).

Key.name: Key

  Decimal = 110,
  Divide = 111,
  F1 = 112,

  NumLock = 144,

  Semicolon = 186,

FeaturesConfig.name: FeaturesConfig
